title: Blatter condemns European 'hate'
desc: Newly re-elected Fifa president Sepp Blatter condemns a hate campaign by European officials and says he was shocked by the comments of US prosecutors.

title: US demands China halt reclamations
desc: The US calls for an immediate halt to land reclamation in disputed areas of the South China Sea saying China is out of step with international rules.

title: Lung cancer therapy is 'milestone'
desc: A lung cancer therapy can more than double life expectancy in some patients a major trial shows.

title: Silk Road drug site founder jailed
desc: Ross Ulbricht the founder of online illegal drug marketplace the Silk Road is sentenced to life in prison.

title: US discovers more anthrax shipments
desc: The US military orders a review into how it handles anthrax after discovering more cases of live anthrax sent to laboratories including one in Australia.

title: Saved by the Bell actor convicted
desc: Former Saved by the Bell actor Dustin Diamond is convicted of two charges after a bar fight on Christmas Day - but cleared of a more serious claim.

title: Sarkozy renames French opposition
desc: France's main opposition party led by ex-president Nicolas Sarkozy has changed its name from UMP to The Republicans despite fierce opposition from critics.

title: Gunmen kill 19 in Pakistan bus raids
desc: Gunmen in Pakistan's Balochistan province kill at least 19 passengers after taking over two Karachi-bound buses officials say.

title: Italy rescues 3300 boat migrants
desc: Italy rescued a total of more than 3300 migrants trying to cross the Mediterranean on Friday the country's coastguard says.

title: Germany 'hits global birth rate low'
desc: A study says Germany's birth rate has slumped to the lowest in the world prompting fears labour market shortages will damage the economy.

title: VIDEO: Cuba removed from US terrorism list
desc: The United States has removed Cuba from its list of state sponsors of terrorism.

title: VIDEO: How Sepp Blatter charmed Africa
desc: Sepp Blatter has been re-elected as president of football's world governing body despite widespread allegations of corruption at FIFA.

title: VIDEO: Inside Malaysia's migrant jungle camps
desc: Ian Pannell and cameraman Darren Conway went to migrant camps on Malaysia's border where traffickers abused and killed Rohingya Muslims.

title: VIDEO: Lung cancer therapy hope for patients
desc: A lung cancer therapy can more than double life expectancy in some patients a milestone trial shows.

title: VIDEO: Napoleon's life in Lego for anniversary
desc: The 200th anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo is to be marked with an exhibition in the Belgian town of Waterloo.

title: VIDEO: Nigeria's historic presidential win
desc: Muhammadu Buhari has been sworn in as Nigeria's president promising to bring increased prosperity to Africa's most populous country.

title: VIDEO: Face transplant man meets donor's sister
desc: A woman whose brother was killed in a car accident has met the man who was given his face in a pioneering transplant operation.

title: VIDEO: US calls halt to land reclamation
desc: The United States has called for an immediate and lasting halt to reclamation works by all claimants in disputed waters in the South China Sea.

title: Cameron's EU tour: Mission accomplished?
desc: The BBC's Katya Adler looks whether British PM David Cameron's whistle-stop tour of the EU to push for changes in the 28-member bloc was a success.

title: Business interests propel change in China's global role
desc: The rising number of Chinese nationals working abroad is causing Beijing to adapt its foreign policy in order to protect them says Jonathan Marcus.

title: Is O'Malley just a Clinton back-up plan?
desc: Former Maryland Governor Martin O'Malley is set to announce a presidential bid on Saturday. Could he challenge Hillary Clinton or is he consigned to being his party's unlikely plan B.

title: Q&A: World Heritage In Danger List
desc: What is Unesco's World Heritage In Danger List and why should we care about it?

title: How do US black students do at school?
desc: Are black children reaching their full potential at US schools - and if not why not?

title: Why the Americans took on Fifa
desc: America doesn't even like football they say so why does it want to clean it up for the world?

title: US economy shrank in first quarter
desc: US economy contracts 0.7% after higher imports and lower investment taken into account.

title: Greek bank deposits at decade low
desc: Greek bank deposits fall to their lowest level in more than 10 years as concerns persist over the country's debt burden and possible euro exit.

title: Porn adware found on FBI web domain
desc: Porn and adwarehave briefly taken over several web domains formerly owned by the FBI and used them to direct people to adware and malware sites.

title: Encryption 'key to free speech'
desc: Encryption software that makes it hard to spy on what people do and say online is essential for free speech says a UN report.

title: Neverland ranch goes up for sale
desc: Michael Jackson's Neverland ranch has gone up for sale for $100m according to reports.

title: Jack Vettriano 'unable to paint'
desc: Scottish artist Jack Vettriano announces he is giving up painting for the foreseeable future due to a recent accident.

title: Barrier Reef spared 'danger' listing
desc: The Great Barrier Reef should not go on the World Heritage danger list according to a United Nations draft report.

title: Alloy bounces back 10 million times
desc: Engineers produce a shape memory alloy that can pop back into shape more than 10 million times shattering previous records for this type of material.

title: Transplant man meets donor's sister
desc: A woman whose brother was killed in a car accident has met the man who was given his face in a pioneering transplant operation.

title: Sleep training 'can reduce prejudice'
desc: Levels of unconscious racist and sexist bias have been reduced by manipulating the way the brain learns during sleep.

title: England & Scotland set for Cup drama
desc: Half a billion people globally get set to watch Arsenal take on Aston Villa in the FA Cup final while Inverness CT face Falkirk in Scotland.

title: Khan claims points win over Algieri
desc: Amir Khan says he wants to take on Floyd Mayweather next after beating Chris Algieri in Friday's welterweight bout.

title: Pilgrimage to the mountains
desc: Photographer Timothy Allen climbs high into the Peruvian Andes for Qoyllur Rit'i - the Snow Star Festival.

title: A symbol of holding out
desc: A shabby old shop that became an architectural landmark has evaded the bulldozer.

title: Musical glass skywalk opens in China
desc: Visitors can play 70 musical notes on cliff-side path.

title: Slovak radios face native music quota
desc: Government wants radio stations to play more Slovak songs.

title: Buhari promises change for Nigeria
desc: Muhammadu Buhari is sworn in as Nigeria's president in front of cheering crowds promising to tackle the Boko Haram insurgency and corruption.

title: More migrants rescued as Asean meets
desc: Myanmar intercepts a boat of 700 migrants off its southern coast as countries agree to try to tackle the crisis at a regional meeting in Bangkok.

title: Merkel: I'll work with UK on EU change
desc: Angela Merkel says she does not rule out future treaty changes as she promises to work constructively with the UK on EU reform.

title: Venezuela blocks ex-presidents' visit
desc: Venezuela has blocked two ex-presidents from visiting opposition leaders jailed on charges of inciting violence against the government.

title: Bomb attack at Saudi Arabia mosque
desc: At least four people die in a bomb attack outside a Shia mosque in Saudi Arabia only a week after more than 20 people were killed in a similar bombing.

title: US removes Cuba from terror list
desc: The United States has removed Cuba from its list of state sponsors of terror allowing the country to conduct banking in the United States among other activities.

title: No £100 fine for late tax returns
desc: People who have filed late tax returns are to be let off paying a £100 fine for missing the deadline HM Revenue and Customs has confirmed.

title: Service for Corrie's Anne Kirkbride
desc: A memorial service for Coronation Street actress Anne Kirkbride is held at Manchester Cathedral.

title: Boy in court over knife murders
desc: A 16-year-old boy appears in court charged with the murders of a man and woman in Colchester.

title: First minister attending Irish Open
desc: First Minister Peter Robinson is at the Irish Open golf tournament in Newcastle County Down a day after being discharged from hospital.

desc: Who won? The official poster for the 2015 festival

desc: Party time at the 60th song contest in Vienna
